newsitem.title: LEBANON: New Lebanese parliament meets to elect speaker.
newsitem.headline: New Lebanese parliament meets to elect speaker.

text.p: Lebanon's newly-elected parliament met on Tuesday for the first time to elect a speaker and begin the procedure for the appointment of a new prime minister and the formation of a new government.
The 128 deputies, divided 50-50 between Moslems and Christians, were expected to reappoint outgoing Speaker Nabih Berri, to a second four-year term.
Billionaire Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri, who resigned on October 15 to make way for the appointment of a new prime minister and cabinet, was also expected to be reappointed.
President Elias Hrawi will begin consultations with the deputies on their choice of a new prime minister after the speaker and other parliamentary officials are chosen.
Once the prime minister is named, he begins negotiations on the formation of a new cabinet, which political sources expect to be in place by the end of the month.
